CatDescriptText: Hydiyyah Taha, insurance agent, Homestead and Richard Gauffney, 192 Wylie Avenue, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 16, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "What do you think the main issues will be, or should be, in the coming presidential campaign?" Ms. Taha's answer reads: "I haven't been thinking too much one way or the other about politics."  Mr. Gauffney's answer reads: "I'd like to see the Republicans win.  Their policies are o.k."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Hydiyyah Taha wearing plaid dress, cardigan, and eyeglasses, standing in front of window with sign inscribed "...Life Insurance Assoc."; Portrait of Richard Gauffney wearing textured suit jacket, button down collared shirt with dashed stripes and hat, standing in front of brick wall
